intro: Euphrasia salisburgensis subsp. portae, commonly known as the Salzburg eyebright, is a flowering plant native to central Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and streambanks. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive yellowish-green color. This subspecies is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
